message: its a game. pretty fun. http://4clojure.com/
It is indeed fun. Some of the problems are pretty challenging. I started it on Friday or Saturday and got thru the first 59 by the end of Sunday. Just catching up now - one down, one to go :)
I'm #60 after an evening. Should be easy to beat me.. if you dare. CHALLENGE!
It's fun, but for Clojure / FP newbies like me it'd be nice to have a "Cheat" button that would link to relevant docs for the current problem :)
yea.. I've basically been stuck on this stupid flattening of lists. *grumble*

@justin, yeah, that one held me up for quite a while! @hans, most of the examples are about solving problems with basic constructs rather than relying on the library functions. When I first started with Clojure, I went to Amit Rathore's ProClojure boot camp and the first half of the day was mostly writing a lot of the core Clojure functions from first principles so that we got a good understanding of them... great experience!

@seancorfield True, most of the docs would not be useful as we are being asked to replicate many of the core functions. But some links to basic info (variable assignment, loop / recur, etc.) would have been very helpful.
@justinlilly Same here! I know how to do it in pseudocode but I can't implement it right with Clojure. Need to do some testing in a REPL or something.
@hans, it sounds fun to hear "variable assignment" and Clojure in the same sentence :)
if yo look at clojuredocs.com, it has better docs and also links to source of functions.
